title: Enterprise Collaboration and Business Networks
segmentation: I actually was invited last week to present to the Social Champions Group of the Royal Society for the Encouragement of the Arts Manufacturing Commerce in London.
20,000 volunteers around the world who part of this voluntary Association and to talk about how they could use social media to do what they do better.
And the lady who asked me had been involved in some of the things we've done.
She was next analyst.
She was aware that we had an internal adoption process for promoting social media and IBM.
And she asked me to talk about the program and I realized as I was putting the slides together, is actually almost exactly the 5th anniversary.
So we've for five years IBM has been actively promoting use of social media within the company.
The technology platforms that we provide to our customers for this come out of this stuff.
IBM Research, which is largest privately owned research organization in the world, have been doing for the previous five years, right?
So this is not something new for us.
This is something we've got a lot of experience in, and what I wanted to talk about is not so much.
The technology and what we do or even what we do internally, although that's fascinating.
But what are the business application?
Why should businesses be interested in this?
What our business is interested in.
They're not interested in social media just because it's social media.
They want Better Business results.
To me 4 things kind of driving what's happening in social media and they come out a little bit this morning.
Clearly the social platforms, the online social networking sites.
Yep, we get that.
It's kind of what the Internet was born for.
We just didn't realize it till now.
Then you've got mobile devices.
Most of social interaction is mobile.
Great example, I told you imagine you're walking down the street and you saw a poster from one of your competitors.
There's a big poster just outside San Diego Airport by Audi.
Put up.
Which which just had the latest sports car and it said BMW your move right?
You can imagine a BMW guy walking down the road thinking well, what are we going to do about that?
So in the Old World he tried to remember when he got back to the office to research who in marketing he should tell him and send them an email and it would probably never get done right.
In today's world we are in the five years ago world.
I guess he got out his BlackBerry.
He'd send an email to someone he knew and hope it found its way to the right person.
Today's social world.
He gets out his iPhone.
He takes a picture of the poster.
He goes into his internal social network.
He asks it who is the marketing expert for San Diego in the company.
He gets the result.
He sends them the equivalent of an internal tweet.
That's a much more responsive reaction that's going to generate much more value to the organization.
I was talking to a large bread manufacture a few weeks ago about their Facebook site.
They said it's a great site for building better marketing plans.
Marketing are using Facebook to build better marketing programs, but it's not like you bread any better.
It's not making your distribution channels any better.
It's about how social media affects your whole organization.
End to end.
That's what excites me mobile devices.
Whatever thoughts enter your head very often when you're not in front of a PC.
It's unusual for me to sit into in front of an audience where more than 50% of you are tapping on a PC.
But everybody has a mobile phone in that in their pockets.
Cloud clearly isn't enabling technology for this, But the interesting one to me is is is low bit of solomo which is so fashionable which is location.
I prefer the word context.
It's all driven by analytics.
It's about I've discovered a fact, a person, an object.
How do I generate maximum value out of it?
It's by context of other information that rotates around it.
That's where big data comes in.
That's where analytics comes.
I turned it big analytics on the chart so a social business to IBM is a business which specifically focuses on embracing networks of people to deliver business value.
We no longer in the business of how do we manage content repositories?
How do we manage documents?
It's about.
We don't train people to become experts.
We figure out how to put networks of people around who can achieve Better Business outcomes without everybody having to be trained on everything.
It's a different way of viewing the way organ.
Izations work.
To me, a lot of people walk up to me and say we want to get into social media.
How should we do it?
And I say what problem you're trying to solve and most people don't know.
Well.
We think we should be using social media or not is that problem?
What's your business problem?
There's no shortage of business problems.
Organisations focus what they're doing, beginning to learn to do is focus on finding a business problem they can fix with social media and that's why they're doing the social media, not becausw.
The marketing manager now has a budget for social media stuff.
So he goes and does some.
Thing.
It comes to me.
There are four basic domains for application which we see which is kind of looking at the market social sentiment analysis.
All that stuff looking at your customers exceptional customer experience across website.
Center mobile devices and offices.
If you have them delivering an integrated multi channel experience that integrate social media.
When I go to somebody's website, I don't necessarily want to create a unique user ID password there just to get a customized website.
I'm happy to associate it with my Facebook account so they know who I am now.
They know my Facebook details.
They can put a little box on the corner of the home screen which says here are your friends who also have subscribed to our service or already use our customer.
Already already our customers, I can talk to them, get recommendations from them, and more likely to stay sticky to the to that particular company.
Then partnering extended enterprise very few enterprises stand alone anymore.
Need to collaborate across organizational boundaries?

An internal social collaboration and my contention that I put forward very strongly is if you, as an organization are not focused on empowering your people to use social media to share their knowledge, to collaborate, to create networks of people, to do the job better.
You're not going to deliver an effective, effective, authentic social experience outside to the market to your customers or to your partners.
Lots of parts of the organization can use social media for lots of other things.
It's not just about integrating Twitter somehow into your business processes, it's a much more complex integration problem.
And there are lots more starting points, which is why you need those business pains to decide what to do next.
But you want some common platforms that you deliver all these solutions off.
What most companies do is they start with little tactical problems on the left hand side there in a particular domain.

Get confident that this is actually helping them and move towards where they really need to be, which is cross organizational cost, business process, cross silo, deployment of social collaboration technologies internally in order to serve their customers channels.
And the market better so fundamentally to me, social media is about business process transformation.
It's about changing the way organisations work.
Social media has come along as this catalyst, which just the right time when everything is in place.

The internets in place, the mobile devices are in Place, Cloud is in the places that deployment mechanism where organisations can now take advantage of it to transform the way they do business, not just to change the technology they use to share information with each other.
Some links there if you're interested in the later, I'm sure we'll share the presentations, thanks.
